sub_topic: Calculation of efficiency of a refrigerator
message_1: Calculate the coefficient of performance (COP) of a refrigerator that operates between temperatures of 0°C and 5°C, and consumes 500 J of work to remove 1000 J of heat from the food inside the refrigerator.
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a refrigerator is defined as the ratio of the heat removed from the food (Q_c) to the work input (W) required to run the refrigerator. Mathematically, it can be expressed as:

COP = Q_c / W

In this problem, we are given the following values:

Q_c = 1000 J (heat removed from the food)
W = 500 J (work input)

Now, we can calculate the COP:

COP = 1000 J / 500 J = 2

The coefficient of performance of the refrigerator is 2. This means that for every 1 Joule of work input, the refrigerator removes 2 Joules of heat from the food.
